title: Genetic Diversity and Phylodynamics of Avian Coronaviruses in Egyptian Wild Birds

title: Does genetic diversity limit disease spread in natural host populations?
text:
Thus, host population genetic diversity seems to have an important role in buffering populations against epidemics
Consistent with results from agricultural populations, the existing literature suggests that high genetic diversity could buffer host populations against disease spread
